p: A total of 1,689 samples of suspected patients of dengue virus infection referred to the VRDL for confirmation of diagnosis of dengue fever over a period of three years, from January 2016 to December 2018 were considered for this study. Out of these, 272 (16.10%) samples were found to positive for dengue virus positive (seropositive) ( TableÂ 1). Based on the number of days of fever, 1394 serum samples were tested for anti-dengue IgM antibodies and 295 for NS1antigen.63 (3.73%) samples were serologically positive for NS1 antigen and 209 (12.37%) samples positive for anti-dengue IgM antibodies ( Table 1). During this study period, it is seen that dengue was endemically present in the region.
